website_summaries.verdict: If you need to scan photographic prints and an occasional short text document, but don't need to scan film, the Canon CanoScan LiDE220 Color Image Scanner is our top pick.
pros: Image enhancements include color restore and dust removal
Scans to searchable PDF and editable text formats
cons: Inconsistent commands from one choice for scanning to the next

customer_reviews.title: Pro Scanner for little money
customer_reviews.text: Forget Epson's ! I bought this scanner just as a temporary while I was looking for Epson Perfection V700, to my surprise this is twice as fast, colour rendition is as good if not better, scanning software can be set to your liking and it will scan, crop and save several photos in one go. I have Canon large format printer too, so included software works like a photo copier. Insert A4 photo in the scanner and it will enlarge it to A2, A1 or A0 and print it on the large format automatically. Fantastic. No power supply needed as it's powered from USB. Scan negatives without back light and just reverse in Photoshop. Simply amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Correction to my previous review, I've noticed that in addition to the scaner not actually scanning the very edges of the document, my particular unit is also misaligned, causing any scan to be rotated by about a degree. This makes it impossible to actually get a straight scan. Additionally it started generating streaks in scanned images, this was resolved by recalibrating it but the option for this is thoroughly buried.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this scanner!
customer_reviews.text: Everytime I have tried to scan documents with this I may get one page done and it quits or it just goes halfway to scanning, freezes for several minutes and then says there was a disconnection. Absolute pish!
customer_reviews.author: Buraddori

customer_reviews.title: Caution to Mac Users
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scanner to replace a Canon LIDE 60 as this scanner isn't supported on the Mac. The LIDE 220 claims to be compatible with the Mac but it doesn't seem to be. Every time I try to scan I get an error message which Canon are trying to resolve. If you are a Mac user, I would recommend trying another make of scanner. If Canon do get this issue resolved I will update this review. If I boot the Mac into Windows, the scanner works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: MacBook Pro 2016 compatible
customer_reviews.text: Please note users of USB-C will need a different cable than advertised with Amazon. The scanner uses a Mini-USB port and the above cable works and powers the scanner. Having tested it, the software works and documents are crisp, visible and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mr H Kishi

customer_reviews.title: Does not fully work on MACOS High Sierra
customer_reviews.text: This scanner has buttons which should act as shortcuts. But they do not work on MACOS High Sierra. Canon are aware of the problem if you look at their product support pages, and it seems that they blame some Apple security features in the later versions of MACOS. I specifically wanted to use the copy button where it scans and is immediately prints which is what the copy button was supposed to do. If you are not bothered about the buttons not working and just want to digitise things then it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve A

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy if you are using Mac High Sierra
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scanner according to Canon because it was compatible with the MAC operating system. Whereas it does scan, the key feature of this scanner is My Garden Image is apparently not compatible with MacOS High Sierra 10.13.4 (High Sierra).I notified Canon who say it is down to technical incompatibility between the OS and the scanner and if I want this feature to work i should use a PC with a different or older OS.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Naudi

customer_reviews.title: Decent scanner for basic use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a one off project. The scanner is very fast and the software is very good and easy to use. The multiple scanning option is good although does sometimes merge images and they have to be separated and rescanned. As with all scanners in this price range I found that there was light reflection present in dark areas of the scanned images and I had to manually edit these to remove light spots. All in all a good scanner for basic home use but the presence of reflected light on some images knocks it down a star.
customer_reviews.author: Mr P R Grant

customer_reviews.title: Beware of using this with an iMac
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner to replace my LiDe 100, when Canon informed me they would no longer support it under the new OSX 10.11 (El Capitan). The scanner performs well. However, the software supplied together with the Driver is very poor. It often disconnects itself from the iMac and the only way to reconnect it is to remove the USB cable and reconnect. I have been it contact with Canon over this problem, and they admit it is a shortcoming in the Driver. The Driver instructions even state that this will happen. Overall, rather disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Great little scanner for all uses, easy to set up and quick to scan. Auto page detection is excellent, saves cropping scanned receipts etc. USB power is so convenient. On the down side, while it will scan at the stated resolution of 4800 DPI, it's not available from the drop down options and has to be set manually in advanced mode. It also cannot handle this above a small size, although this is mainly down t the software. This is really a great little scanner for everyday tasks, I would not recommend it for professional digital archiving, but then for the price, you really can't do much better. It's also very compact, not much larger than a sheet of A4
customer_reviews.author: Chaz G

customer_reviews.title: A poor piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectation for LiDE 220 after looking at various reviews. Sadly I can't give much positive feedback, install wasn't easy and the interface is really not very intuitive. I managed to scan one image before the scanner defaulted to it's 'warming up' stage, which is endless before becoming completely unresponsive. A piece of tat in my case so avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: GraphicScribe19

customer_reviews.title: This scanner is absolutely perfect for me - it's compact
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is absolutely perfect for me - it's compact, USB powered, I had absolutely no problems setting it up on Windows 10, and it has worked flawlessly since installation. Scan quality is great for what I need - scanning sketches in to be worked in photoshop. I couldn't comment on the quality of scans for actual photographs but I assume it would be pretty decent. For the price it seems like an absolute bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely useless
customer_reviews.text: This scanner comes with no instructions for Mac. I downloaded the driver software from the internet and it installs a set of icons on the desktop. Each icon when clicked opens up a web page with an internal error message, including the help icon. I have no idea how to use it now - it is completely defunct. If no-one comes back to me about this I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Holly A Small

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Looks good but minor problem with software - have requested a support ticket - nevertheless, I'm sure it will be solved easily. Canon means quality - later: connecting it to a USB port on laptop itself rather than on a hub did the trick - really worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Paulus

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use scanner
customer_reviews.text: We have Linux on our computers so it would have been nice if the Set-up disc supplied with the scanner provided support for platforms other than Windows. However, we found XSane which does a good job and I get good results so am still pleased with our purchase. The scanner itself is simple to use and sits happily on top of my printer. Just one cable from back of scanner into computer which can be tucked away when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela C

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is not compatible with my Asus laptop using Windows 10. This seems to be a common problem to judge by the large number of critical online comments which I wish I had read before I purchased the scanner.
customer_reviews.author: MR SL TURTLE

customer_reviews.title: Great portable scanner!
customer_reviews.text: This actul scanner model ive used for the last 4 years for work. Its taken a lot of knocks over the years as i take it with me to appointments. Due to this stopped working. This purchase was to replace it. I use it to scan bank statements, passports, driving licenses for mortgage applications, and its great. Black and white and colour options. Can scan lots of documents one after another into one pdf file. I cant comment on the tech support as ive never used them.
customer_reviews.author: Zii

customer_reviews.title: good scanner let down by poor software. Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable scanner only let down by the horrible supplied software which is too complex and not intuitive. I use NAPS2 freeware scanner software which works a treat and is far easier to use and less obtrusive. Would be a 4 star product if the software was better. Not recommended. Pros Small footprint. Powered from USB. Good quality scanner. Cons Canon software is very poor. Too complicated, non-intuitive and intrusive on my system. Some of the scanner buttons do not work but this may be due to the fact that configuring them from the supplied Canon software does not seem to work.
customer_reviews.author: DJM

customer_reviews.title: Totally unreliable scanner
customer_reviews.text: I love Canon, but this is total waste of their name and reputation. Constantly get errors from it. Either USB Cable not connected, when it tries to scan the software locks up, software scans blank page when it's full of text, or scans half page only, or scans several pages and then a black or blank page. Totally unreliable and have wasted so much of my time trying to scan with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobble

customer_reviews.title: Very poor scans when it actually works
customer_reviews.text: Crashes all the time and doesn't scan Scan quality very poor even on highest settings Scans come out wonky and distorted Error messages constantly saying device is turned off part way through scanning Very flimsy and feels cheap
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but let down by software on macOS
customer_reviews.text: In OS X the built-in driver allows to select 600dpi max (much less than my previous Epson V600). The included software (Canon Gear) is a mess. Difficult to use, not following Apple Interface Guidelines – I have uninstalled it. Canon - please hire two good developers and they make a software in a year! It doesn't need to have all those fancy settings, filters etc. – most users will use Pixelmator, Photoshop for that - just allow to acquire the image in a nice way. The biggest advantage of this scanner is that it is USB powered so you will not need power adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Tomasz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic piece of kit and so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This piece of equipment is brilliant. I no longer have to go the shops to photocopy. The quality of the copies are brilliant. The machine is compact and take very little space, no electrical cord, just USB. The best part is that anyone can easily use it and from the time of unpacking it - it took me 10 minutes approx. to figure out how to use it. Finally great value for money. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is so easy to setup and use, just pop the disc in and in 5 minutes you're ready to go, the colour matching is extremely good and the auto cropping feature for single and multiple images makes it a dream to use! It also comes with a side stand which is a really nice feature that conserves a great deal of space. With this being a LED scanner it doesn't handle neon colours very well but other than that an excellent piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: S Young

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: Lovely and easy to use. A sleek design, it scans relatively silently. Quite quick as well. Easy to install. I am over the moon with it, very good quality for the money. Fully recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Good value scanner
customer_reviews.text: After upgrading to a new PC, my previous Canon scanner would not work in Windows 10. Its early days as I have only just received it and set it up. Just done a multi page PDF scan and so far, so good. I am pleased to say that this replacement machine is quicker and seems to have better software than the previous one. The Scangear program (for advanced scanning) seems to have the same functionality, including the very handy Preview function. So well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: JohnT

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't mind the cheap, flimsy lid that I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't mind the cheap, flimsy lid that I'm afraid to handle with anything more than delicate care in fear of breaking it if the damn thing worked more than one attempt out of six, because of the awful software or total and abrupt failure of communications between the computer and the scanner, usually mid-scan or upon completing the scan. It's easier and faster to light the image manually and just take a damn photograph of it than fight the failure prone, user unfriendly, unintuitive UI mess of a program.
customer_reviews.author: Jessy Foxx

customer_reviews.title: Connection problems
customer_reviews.text: When the scanner connects to the computer it works fine however most of the time the connection fails. I tried rerunning the set up software several times and found that it connected but only temporarily. By chance I discovered that going into Photoshop Elements Editor connects it but that takes some time and is a definite drawback.
customer_reviews.author: ShaunJM

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent scanner.
customer_reviews.text: Good flatbed scanner for documents slightly larger than A4. The software is easy to setup and configure and the scans are decent. It is quite slow at the highest dpi scans, so if say you expect to scan more than a dozen pages, you'll want to scan at lower quality settings to speed things up.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate and works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Macbook Air. Easy to operate and works well. I ordered this after discovering that my Canoscan 3200F was not compatible with Mac and the software with Windows 7 on my desktop. However a second attempt to match the Canoscan 3200F with Windows 7 resulted in Microsoft providing the necessary drivers on line. Motto- don't buy in haste or be overly influenced by everything you read onThe Web. Just connect the Canoscan to your PC and let it search for the drivers. Takes a while but well worth the wait. It remains to be seen if this will work with Windows 10. The 3200F is by far the better scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Nosey Parker

customer_reviews.title: Flat bed scanner
customer_reviews.text: This unit is quite thin, and takes up much less space than most flatbeds, it is powered from the computer USB socket and therefore requires no external power supply,it is a little complicated to first set up, however once all the settings are chosen it copies and scans perfectly, I have found it to be a good choice,because it does everything I expect of it.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Carter

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It works what more can one say except I have used it on machines running Windows 7 and Windows 10, plugged it in and it sorted itself out on both occasions and I never looked at the instructions. One thing that is particuarly good is the copy function sending output directly to the printer.
customer_reviews.author: wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Super quality
customer_reviews.text: Great hardware. Software isn't the most intuitive to use, and is close to impossible to configure to get the absolute highest quality available from the scanner, but Google helps. I haven't found a scanner which exceeds this one in quality for this price, size, and portability factor. Would strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Neon

customer_reviews.title: I love this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I'm no computer geek but found it easy to install and use. The front buttons are a boon. Being laid up for a while I have scanned anything and everything I can find at 10 seconds a scan I have scanned hundreds of documents and old photos with no issues.Scanning multiple photos into individual files is a great time saving feature. The stitch feature requires manual alignment intervention as far as can find out there is no automatic alignment. On first installation the front buttons didn't work but following the trouble shooting tips a reinstalled fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Evans

customer_reviews.title: Better than I had expected from some of the lower-stared reviews on here.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted, having had a brilliant Canon Scanner in the past. I was worried, reading some of the lower stared reviews here, that some of the functionality had gone - but not a bit of it. IF you want to scan a small area, you can, just as always - you just need to go to "Start Scan Gear", in the Canon Quick Menu - and the option is available there. :) The scanner is smoother, quieter and quicker than my older scanner, and this is therefore improved in every way. I am very happy with this purchase. It also arrive quickly and exactly as stated. A very worthy 5-stars.
customer_reviews.author: linum

customer_reviews.title: Can be a moody
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scanner, when it decides not to throw a tantrum and actually work. I have found that it will work in one USB port, but not another, and there is no predicting which way it will go until you actually plug it in and give it a whirl. But when it decides to work, the results are stunning.
customer_reviews.author: Lazarus

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have tried it with Mac and works like a breeze, no additional driver is required
customer_reviews.author: Sia Rajabi

customer_reviews.title: excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: A simple to set up[ and use scanner, it performs well, but not superbly. I suspect that you might have to go for a model that is separately powered (ie not by USB as this one is).to get a 5* rating from me. I am slightly irritated that the scanned image seems to be slightly skewed and the ScanGear software does not offer any colour corrections at the preview stage. ( I tend to use VueScan) However, at the price, excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: musketry

customer_reviews.title: Very disatisfied
customer_reviews.text: After loading drivers etc. the scanner would not operate using the manual buttons. A quick google suggested that this is a very common problem with no easy fix. I have always thought of Canon as a supplier of quality kit but this makes me think otherwise - total waste of my time
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: A great improvement on my old Lide25
customer_reviews.text: Good scanner, very quick scan and several auto scan choices. Only had it a week so still learning all the options but so far easy to use. My old Lide 25 came with canoscan toolbox and Photosuite 5.5 as part of the package. Would have liked something similar with this scanner. Maybe updated photo suite.
customer_reviews.author: Arrowmaker

customer_reviews.title: Small and fast scanner. Good results.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my ageing scanner with this one. Very small footprint, fast to scan, good results and powered from usb port. I could not get the auto scan button to work without installing latest drivers. Won't dock a star for that as I always install latest drivers for all kit I buy. Button works fine now. The stand is not required even though it appears to be from reading the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Tzap

customer_reviews.title: The product scans the pages askew
customer_reviews.text: The product scans the pages askew - I should have replaced the product long ago, but since I rarely use the scanner, I didn't see the defect in time. I guess that is the reason for the cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and well-made piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Produces good results with useful bundle of software. The box includes a fitting to stand the scanner on its side, which is handy; whilst you can scan in that position, for ease of use if you are processing a lot of pictures it's best to set it down flat.
customer_reviews.author: Maxzie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Blown away by the scanning quality for the price, very impressed - managed to scan some 6mm x 10mm pics from one of those "silly" photobooths in at very high quality
customer_reviews.author: Sue De Nym

customer_reviews.title: Too early to review a new model but I can ...
customer_reviews.text: Too early to review a new model but I can say why I bought it. In 15 years of computing I've only had two scanners - both earlier models from Canon. Neither broke down: first one had to be retired because it needed a parallel port & my new computer couldn't accommodate it & the one that replaced it & which has lasted 10 years must also be retired because Canon no longer provides drivers for it & Windows 10 doesn't recognize it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. P. S. Yorks

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use scanner with the quality you would expect from Cannon
customer_reviews.text: This Canon scanner replaces my original one which used defunct Twain drivers. It plugs directly into my IMac USB port (which powers the unit) and uses the Mac OS image capture app, without the need to load any other software, in fact the OS had already got the drivers so it was plug and play straight out of the box. I just need to remember to unlock it before plugging it in.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Man

customer_reviews.title: Great little Scanner.
customer_reviews.text: Had a old unit that has been working since Windows XP and would still scan now if I could find drivers to run with Windows 7. After a lot of looking I opted for this unit, small light and about a quarter the size of the unit it replaced. Powered via the USB meant one less power block and one spare mains socket. Scanner is fast and so easy to use, the resultant scans are stunning. I really do love this unit.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Beware do not buy for iMAC
customer_reviews.text: Only a Microsoft disc included when opened checked with Cannon told me this is not compatible with latest Mac!! would be helpful to state this on the spec!! before ordering Returned it in disgust won't be buying Cannon again
customer_reviews.author: david mcgauley

customer_reviews.title: but the driver software has changed compared to my old LiDe 70 scanner and as a result the program I use to save the scans will
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly....but the driver software has changed compared to my old LiDe 70 scanner and as a result the program I use to save the scans will only bring up a very basic scanning program and I have go into the scanner driver software of the 220 to achieve the best results. Other that that niggle an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR ILLUSTRATIONS ON MAC!
customer_reviews.text: Really great scanner for art and illustrations! I’m an illustration student at university and was looking for a scanner for home due to my university temporarily closing- this scanner works great and maybe even better than some of the scanners they supply on my course. The illustrations come out great, it’s easy to use and scans straight to photoshop. I use it alongside my MacBook, and as long as you download all of the software for the scanner onto your laptop, it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Yasmin Thompson-lamont

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, I like the USB connection
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner, I like the USB connection, only slightly let down by the software, manual is pretty unhelpful, most standard settings only go to 600 dpi, but with some effort you can find the advanced settings allowing user input of required higher dpi, the defaults can be overridden as I use 800 generally. Very good value overall.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Handy scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy & portable bit of kit. Took me a little while to get used to the function of the buttons & the Canon software load onto the PC but works well. It feels a bit lightweight compared with previous (mains powered) scanners but works well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: CanoScan LiDE 220 - Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Installed Win 7 64bit and all functions are ok. Very good installation cd. No problems and scan quality is superb. Supplied USB lead of a good length and eliminates the need for a separate power supply - brilliant. A well made product with a slightly flimsy lid. No complaints. Highly recommended. 5 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: penultimate

customer_reviews.title: Dreadful installation, OK afterwards
customer_reviews.text: Installation was clunky, and for about 20 minutes after declaring itself 'installed', there was a completely hidden process in the background hogging all my memory. Until this had cleared itself, the scanner would not work, although the screen said scan complete, I never heard the scanner work, and the output was a small text file detailing the process only!!. Finally, the memory was freed, and it has since worked satisfactorily, all I have to do is work out how to use the interface.
customer_reviews.author: B Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Very good scanner
customer_reviews.text: My first reort on this scanner was not good - complainig of over complication compaed with the old 8000 scanner. I have now used this scanner since August 2018 and after 2 weeks I found my way round it. I now find it convenient and quick to use. I has shown no problems and produces excelllent copies of text and colour photos. Bill H
customer_reviews.author: Bill H.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this scanner, my only issue with it is it did take me a while to get used to the software but after some time with it, it is super easy! For anyone wondering, I used the software that came on the disc and it works great. People however do download the latest software online but just though I'd let you guys know that the software on the disc is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and compact enough to hide away. Easy to use, am very happy with it. I'm sure that had I spent the money on an all singing all dancing one then I would notice a differenc but as I use it once in a blue moon it more than does the job for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve986

customer_reviews.title: Good Scanner But Mac Software Not Great
customer_reviews.text: Been using this scanner on my Mac for years, on all OS versions. Best to just use Apple's in-built Image Capture app rather than Canon's bloated software - plug the scanner in and it should show up on the left of the app.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lamsdale

customer_reviews.title: Like it.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to digitize a boat load of old photos this amazingly can do several at one time, wow. Also it's usb powered. Not yet worked out if if I can scan and email direct from the scanner but that would be a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Mavis Davison

customer_reviews.title: Quality as you'd expect from Canon
customer_reviews.text: Bought for scanning in a bunch of old photographs to make a photobook. Does the job very well for the price point and is portable enough to buy as an impulse purchase as it really won't take up too much storage room.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great for photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to scan old photos to store online. It does this really well scanning a number at any time separating them and storing each as a named file. Good quality and the software that I downloaded rather than using the supplied CD works well and is intuitive to use. Good price for a scanner of this quality.
customer_reviews.author: Leobhan

customer_reviews.title: I manage to make it work, but each time ...
customer_reviews.text: I manage to make it work , but each time I use it I have to disconnect and re-connect. You have to be very careful each time in sorting the settings. I understand why some people never managed to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Lo P.

customer_reviews.title: buttons don't work on mac - you have to open a mac app to make scans
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, does not work as advertised if you have a mac. You can scan with it, but not by using the buttons on the front, they're useless. You have to use the software utilities that come with the scanner. The only reason I bought this scanner was because I thought it would nice to have a scanner you simply put a document down and press a single button and you're done. Nope, the buttons don't work.
customer_reviews.author: Admin Kat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very slim and fast! Excellent value for money!
customer_reviews.text: superb and very easy to use - simply plug into the PC with the cable provided! no plug or anything required. Fast scanning to the computer or direct to printer + other features. Very slim too. Extremely pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner, I bought it while it was on sale (about 20%) and haven't had any problems with it. The quick scan button if great if you need to scan a document really quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry Yurin

customer_reviews.title: Canoscan LiDE 220.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item. It didn't work, but I later discovered it was my fault. Sorry I messed up installation. I am sure it would have been a good and quality scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. James Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality USB scanner
customer_reviews.text: Had been looking for a compact USB scanner. This has been perfect. Good quality scans. VERY easy to use. Quick to plug in, use and put away again. It simply lives in a desk drawer - when I want to use it I just connect the cable to the USB in my laptop and its operational in 20 seconds. No need for power cable makes this really convenient. Perfect. Good value too. Would happily recommend this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: A reader

customer_reviews.title: Scan from books=yes, doing it quietly=no
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine, the ability to scan stuff from in sketch books was my reason for buying it and it definitely does that, not the quietest scanner but nothing like as bad as the old one I had!
customer_reviews.author: jeremy stout

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner so far, works fine with Windows 10. The Windows store has a scanner app you can use which works nicely alongside the scanner. Worth the price in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with this scanner (after I managed to get the ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this scanner (after I managed to get the driver and software installed that is). I've been using it mainly to scan old photos which it does really well especially with the software that came with it. It can scan multiple photos and actually crop them correctly before transferring them into your selected folder, brilliant, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Skinnyman

customer_reviews.title: A good paper weight
customer_reviews.text: It constantly disconnects and very rarely is able to scan an image before disconnecting. Absolute total waste of money - should have spent more on a better model.
customer_reviews.author: Esuohdla

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, I am still exploring just what it ...
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner, I am still exploring just what it can do, but so far, I've had some great results. Fast delivery service, Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Good budget scanner
customer_reviews.text: Good, functional compact scanner. Replaced an older Canon scanner that was not supported under 64 bit windows. Scan quality seems as good, warms up faster but the software is not as flexible. Software does work, but gives a bit less control hence 4* rather than 5* - I know it could have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Yorxbrox

customer_reviews.title: that takes an excellent scan to reproduce an old photograph
customer_reviews.text: Not having had a new scanner for a LONG time, I bought this after my previous long-serving HP model packed in batch-svanning photographs. If what you want is a simple-to-use scanner with presets that can be over-ridden by personal settings, that can email, store or stack scans, that takes an excellent scan to reproduce an old photograph, do not hesitate to try this one. Extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Lulubeth

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Neat, well made and great performance scanner. Fits perfectly into a corner of my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Toots7

customer_reviews.title: Tidy and well designed.
customer_reviews.text: Just amazed at how easy this is to set up and use. Standard A to B USB cable now which powers the whole thing and assuming that you have fairly standard applications for email etc pressing the right button on the unit scans the document and opens the app with the image there. Very neat.
customer_reviews.author: M. Clark

customer_reviews.title: It is fast and provides good quality scans but you will have to persevere with the software.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and the scanner does the job in 1/3 of the time compared to my previous Canoscan Lide 30. I did not like the softwAre provided but managed to adapt the software from my previous scanner.
customer_reviews.author: G. Finnie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This little beauty is exactly what I wanted, installed the drivers, detected in windows 7 64 and off I went. Not the fastest or clearest out there, but certainly in my opinion the best for the price and will fullfill 90% of peoples every day needs.
customer_reviews.author: ednun pourtahmasbi

customer_reviews.title: It's Good
customer_reviews.text: Most printers these days come with a pre-built scanner, but if you're looking for a standalone scanner for casual use then look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Mwitwa

customer_reviews.title: Good fast scanner with excellent quality image and retailing at ...
customer_reviews.text: Good fast scanner with excellent quality image and retailing at a very competitive price. The hardware is noisy after the scan when the sensor is retracting. I think the software is a little cumbersome (I like options kept simple) and is slow to load when the computer is starting. These are small criticisms really, because I googled a good scanner and this came out top or thereabouts everywhere and I have not been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: This is a great accessory. While perhaps lacking some of the features ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great accessory. While perhaps lacking some of the features of its more expensive counterparts this compact device does everything we need including scanning to different file types, different resolutions and colour/greyscale/monochrome options. Very good value and well worth buying if you just want straightforward scans with minimal headaches. Windows10 picks up the right drivers automatically by the way...
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: Good little scanner
customer_reviews.text: Had several of these over the years. They are not the very best scanners but they do the job well and above all they are easy to use. Just plug in the usb and scan. Beware though, older versions are not supported by Canon to work with the latest Mac OS.
customer_reviews.author: desmondo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great now i can send our granddaughters the ancestors photos
customer_reviews.author: Old Grumpy

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner for home use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little scanner for the home. It doesn't have an automatic feed but most home users don't need one and it takes up a very small space.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Greaves

customer_reviews.title: My Canon scanner works fine. I loaded the software
customer_reviews.text: My Canon scanner works fine. I loaded the software, connected the scanner when told to do so, completed software installation and started to use it! It is a very neat and compact device. I was given plenty of warning about when the scanner was to be delivered and the option to indicate what to do it I was out when it arrived. No problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stott

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner
customer_reviews.text: Needed a scanner to scan loads of old family photos. This was quick and easy to connect to my laptop and push one button for scan. No need for power as it connects with usb to laptop. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great A4 Scanner for Artwork
customer_reviews.text: Scans rapidly and the quality is phenomenal. Great for scanning artwork and price is affordable and worth the investment. Wouldve prefered an A3 size instead of A4 but you can scan an A3 sheet twice (Left side then Right side) and stitch them in the Canon software but other than that I Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good scanner
customer_reviews.text: great item. does what it's supposed to do. had no issues installing on a windows 7 pc and works like a dream. only ever use it to scan text though as I'm blind, so can't comment on how well it handles photos.
customer_reviews.author: kev

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't work with my windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Tried all sorts of downloads and gentle persuation but computer would not recognise this scanner. Item returned
customer_reviews.author: george kinghorn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Works a treat. I am scanning loads of very old photos for children and grandchildren to put on memory sticks for them. They can all have a stick instead of boxes of old photos to go through. Very good quality scans - better than the originals.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs E Evans

customer_reviews.title: Very good & very fast (10 seconds)
customer_reviews.text: Very good & very fast (10 seconds)... but need to press on some things if they're raised off the glass by just a few millimeters (e.g large photo albums) otherwise it results in blurry areas in the scanned image.
customer_reviews.author: JILL MACLEOD

customer_reviews.title: Worked first time
customer_reviews.text: My old Canon lide not supported by latest Microsoft update so had to get a replacement asap. Arrived following day, software installed from DVD and works perfectly. New function s and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: N C Dunlop

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Scanner.
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for an old Lide 70. Should have replaced before - brilliant little photo scanner and the new software is also pretty nifty.
customer_reviews.author: AceOD

customer_reviews.title: portable
customer_reviews.text: No power adaptor needed so it's portable just a usb cable to do both jobs but i wish it was in white colour.
customer_reviews.author: K Zaman

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant and nice colour representation
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant and nice colour representation. So pleased with this purchase and will last me a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: tmadisson

customer_reviews.title: better than the Epson Perfection V39, I tested these side by side.
customer_reviews.text: I thought the Canon LiDE 220 was a much better scanner than the epson myself, it was a bit faster and easier to operate. still the epson did a great job of scanning but my money got the Canon and glad I did. They were tested side by side. Both good scanners but Canon has the edge in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: This is a good scanner and about 10 seconds on a standard 300 ...
customer_reviews.text: I rbought this mostly for document scanning and because my old Lide 100 stopped working reliably with OSX El Capitan and there appeared to be no compatible drivers available. This is a good scanner and about 10 seconds on a standard 300 DIP A4 scan. However one small issue is that the physical scanner buttons do not work in Mac OSX El Capitan. After a conversation with Canon support they claimed this is due to changes in El Capitan. On Yosemite and earlier the scanner buttons will work as they always have. Otherwise this scanner works fine.
customer_reviews.author: T. Llewellyn

customer_reviews.title: Cannon LiDE 220 Compact Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time. Delighted with purchase. Easy to set up. Quality manufactured product.
customer_reviews.author: stardust

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner at a Good Price.
customer_reviews.text: Great little scanner. Arrived six days early on a Sunday despite my having chosen free delivery. USB cable included. No problems installing on W7 and W10 machines. My only issue is that I can't find a way to make it print to a network printer but still searching for a solution to that - meantime I can always print to the local printer on the PC. Before buying I read all the 1* and 2* reviews and can't understand their problems.
customer_reviews.author: G. Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Using with Ubuntu 17. 10 and it all just ...
customer_reviews.text: Using with Ubuntu 17.10 and it all just worked perfectly out of the box. I plugged in the one USB cable, opened up the Simple Scan program that comes with Ubuntu and clicked scan (no driver/software installation at all).
customer_reviews.author: A. Whitehouse

customer_reviews.title: Slim & sleek
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and very happy with our purchase. Slim and trim, so doesn’t take a massive foot print in the desk, and good quality build. Sleek looking in black!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon &.

product_meta.title: Canon CanoScan LiDE 220 Compact Scanner, Black
product_meta.description:
Style Name:4800 x 4800 dpiEnjoy fast, high quality scanning at home with this ultra-compact scanner. Easily capture high resolution photos and documents with the option to send then direct to cloud services using your PC.

LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Boxed and it's new only unpacked all accessories included but no CD driver however can be downloaded free from HP website it will be delivered fast plus 3 months RTB warranty 6

BOX CONTAINS
Scanner unit - CanoScan LiDE 220USB cableUpright StandSetup CD-ROM
Manuals
other documents (CD only for Windows)

See more
feature_bullets: Enjoy high resolution scans up to 4800 x 4800 dpi with CIS sensor
Capture photos with detail and accurate colours thanks to 48-bit internal colour depth
Save time with 300 dpi A4 colour scans delivered in just 10 seconds
Experience the freedom to scan directly to cloud services using your PC
Create multipage PDF documents from the scanner using PDF buttons
Supported Operating Systems :- Windows 10 / 8.1 / 8 / 7 / Vista SP1 & SP2 / XP SP3 32-bit Mac OS X v10.6.8 or later

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,789 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
